title: Toa Halafihi
text:
Toa Halafihi (born 27 November 1993) is a New Zealand born Italian <a href="Rugby%20Union">rugby union</a> player who currently plays as a <a href="Flanker%20%28rugby%20union%29">loose forward</a> for <a href="Benetton%20Rugby">Benetton</a> in the <a href="Pro14">Guinness Pro 14</a> .
Early career.
Born and raised in the city of <a href="Gisborne%2C%20New%20Zealand">Gisborne</a> in the northeastern part of New Zealand, Halafihi was schooled at <a href="Gisborne%20Boys%27%20High%20School">Gisborne Boys' High School</a> in his hometown and played first XV rugby for them. After graduating high school, he played a season of <a href="Heartland%20Championship">Heartland Championship</a> rugby with <a href="Poverty%20Bay%20Rugby%20Football%20Union">Poverty Bay</a> in <a href="2012%20Heartland%20Championship">2012</a> before later moving to Taranaki to play club rugby with Spotswood United.
Senior career.
Halafihi first played provincial rugby for Taranaki during their ITM Cup Premiership title winning season of <a href="2014%20ITM%20Cup">2014</a>, starting once and coming on as a replacement twice. He was much more of a regular in <a href="2015%20ITM%20Cup">2015</a>, scoring 3 times in 9 outings to help the Bulls reach the Premiership semi-finals where they surrendered their crown to eventual winners, , going down 46-20.
<a href="2016%20Mitre%2010%20Cup">2016</a> saw him play in all 11 of Taranki's games and score 5 tries, although owing to stiff competition from the likes of <a href="Lachlan%20Boshier">Lachlan Boshier</a>, <a href="Mitchell%20Brown%20%28rugby%20union%29">Mitchell Brown</a>, <a href="Mitchell%20Crosswell">Mitchell Crosswell</a> and <a href="Iopu%20Iopu-Aso">Iopu Iopu-Aso</a>, he was restricted to just 6 starts. His most memorable moment of the year came when he scored the winning try in a 35-32 win over in the final league stage match which ensured Taranaki would claim a home semi-final. Unfortunately for the men from <a href="New%20Plymouth">New Plymouth</a>, they were defeated 41-29 by and were forced to wait another 12 months before once more trying to reclaim the Premiership title.
Super Rugby.
Good performances at domestic level for Taranaki over the course of the preceding 2 seasons brought him to the attention of <a href="Wellington">Wellington</a>-based Super Rugby franchise, the who named him in their squad ahead of their title defense in <a href="2017%20Super%20Rugby%20season">2017</a>.
International career.
On the 8 December 2021, he was selected by <a href="Alessandro%20Troncon">Alessandro Troncon</a> to be part of an <a href="Italy%20A%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Emerging Italy</a> 27-man squad for the <a href="2021%20end-of-year%20rugby%20union%20internationals">2021 end-of-year rugby union internationals</a>.
